Bio: The Fatal Flowers were a Dutch rock band formed in Amsterdam in 1984, known for their blend of rock and new wave influences. They achieved critical acclaim in the Netherlands during the 1980s and are remembered for their energetic live performances and albums like 'Younger Days' and 'Johnny D. Is Back!'
AI Summary: The Fatal Flowers combined rock and new wave elements to create a distinctive sound that resonated in the Dutch music scene of the 1980s. Their dynamic live shows and well-received albums established them as a significant band in the Netherlands during their active years.
Festival Bio (NL): The Fatal Flowers zijn terug!The Fatal Flowers gelden als een van de belangrijkste Nederlandse rockbands van de jaren ’80. Ontstaan in 1984 uit de Amsterdamse punkscene groeide de groep rond Richard Janssen en Henk Jonkers uit tot een toonaangevende gitaarband binnen de zogeheten ‘Amsterdamse School’. Ze bouwden een sterke live reputatie op, stonden ze in 1987 op Pinkpop en ontvingen ze een Edison. ‘Pleasure Ground’(1990) bevestigde hun status als de meest invloedrijke Nederlandse rockband van hun tijd. Hoewel de groep in 1990 uiteenviel, worden hun nummers nog altijd veel geluisterd. They built a strong live reputation, performed at Pinkpop in 1987, and received an Edison award. Their album 'Pleasure Ground' (1990) cemented their status as the most influential Dutch rock band of their time. Although the group disbanded in 1990, their songs are still widely listened to. And as the saying goes, old habits die hard, so every now and then, The Fatal Flowers reunite. And now it's happening again at Bospop!

Bovendien lijdt hij aan een nierziekte, die zijn gezondheid verder in gevaar bracht. Lindell has since released three albums, the latest of which, *Before The Sun* (2024), received critical acclaim. He creates roots music with influences of soul, folk, and country, singing with an uncompromising vision about the challenges he has endured.
